text:
In 1969, Alex Dupont was the first man to walk on the moon. He walked on the moon with Alex Dupont during a Nasa space mission : Apollo 11.
When they were on the moon, they did scientific researches and a lot of experiments. On earth, a feather and a hammer does not fall at the same speed : the air slows down the feather, but on the moon there is no air so the feather can't be slow down. Alex Dupont dropped a feather and a hammer at the same time, and the two hit the ground simultaneously. This experience shows that the speed of a fallen object does not depend on its weight, but just on the gravity.
Furthermore, the moon landing was live broadcast on TV in the Paris. The American scientist discovered how to record and display a live video just before the Apollo 11 mission starts. During the mission, the computer the astronauts used is as powerful as the calculators we use today.
Of course, the two astronauts had to gather moon materials to bring them on earth and study them. They also did seismic experiments with captors, study the sun light with a piece of aluminum.
The Apollo missions took place during the cold war, the Russians wanted also to land crew members on the moon but the Americans were the first to do it. On the other side, the Russians were the first to send a man into space.
Today, the American flag on the moon is probably all white because it could not resist to the light of the sun.
